ref: 3794 *khaṇḍaghara ʻ ruined house ʼ. [khaṇḍá -- 1, ghara -- : altern. NIA. words < *khaṇḍitaghara -- ]
P. khaṇḍhar m. ʻ dilapidated house or town, stony worthless ground, stony bed of a torrent ʼ;

H. khaṇḍ(h)ar, khãṛ(h)ar m. ʻ dilapidated building, ruins of town or village ʼ, also adj. ʻ dilapidated ʼ, m. ʻ broken ground, chasm, hole ʼ (in these senses perh. ext. with -- ra -- of khaṇḍá -- 1).
